Class Haml::Engine
In: lib/haml/engine.rb
Parent: Object

This is the class where all the parsing and processing of the Haml template is done. It can be directly used by the user by creating a new instance and calling to_html to render the template. For example: 

  template = File.read('templates/really_cool_template.haml')
  haml_engine = Haml::Engine.new(template)
  output = haml_engine.to_html
  puts output

new(template, options = {})

Creates a new instace of Haml::Engine that will compile the given template string when to_html is called. See README for available options.

132:

134:         @options[:filters].merge!({
135:           'erb' => ERB,

138:       end
139:

141:         @options[:filters].merge!({
142:           'redcloth' => RedCloth,
143:           'textile' => Haml::Filters::Textile,
144:           'markdown' => Haml::Filters::Markdown
145:         })
146:       end
147:       if !NOT_LOADED.include? 'bluecloth'
148:         @options[:filters]['markdown'] = Haml::Filters::Markdown
149:       end
150:

154:

160:

162:       # flattened block. -1 signifies that there is no such block.
163:       @flat_spaces = -1

177:       @scope_object = scope
178:       @buffer = Haml::Buffer.new(@options)
179: 
180:       local_assigns = @options[:locals]
181: 
182:       # Get inside the view object's world
183:       @scope_object.instance_eval do
184:         # Set all the local assigns
185:         local_assigns.each do |key,val|
186:           self.class.send(:define_method, key) { val }
187:         end
188:       end
189: 
190:       # Compile the @precompiled buffer
191:       compile &block
192:
